Dr NostrandThat is a wonderful contribution.
I've been studying Medieval Ja=
panese history, the Sengoku Period to Meiji Restoration (the Battle of Port=
 Arthur1580-1910).
Do you have a favorite movie, have you seen 'Ichiban No =
Bushi' or 'Mibu Gishi Den'?
....my dream would be to get a PhD in Japanese =
History....someday with the lottery's cooperation of course :)=C2=A0

John =
G. Herndon; BSc, MBA: Acctg, Fin=C2=A0& Intn'l BusGraduate Prof St Mary's C=
ollege, Moraga: Accounting and EthicsAccounting/Finance/ERP/Venture Capital=
/Taxhttp://www.linkedin.com/in/johngherndon510-648-1083(cell)Ryoyaku kuchi =
ni nigashi.Watashi wa Nihon no furui yarikata ni zokushite imasu.=C2=A0

   On =E2=80=8ETuesday=E2=80=8E, =E2=80=8EMay=E2=80=8E =E2=80=8E1=E2=80=8E,=
 =E2=80=8E2018=E2=80=8E =E2=80=8E09=E2=80=8E:=E2=80=8E41=E2=80=8E:=E2=80=8E=
27=E2=80=8E =E2=80=8EAM, 'Barbara Nostrand, PhD' nostrand@... [samuraih=
istory] <samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com> wrote:  
 
 =C2=A0   
Musashi side=
d with the Toyotomi=E2=80=99s and the army of the West.. They lost. Musashi=
 was among other things at both battles of Osaka castle.. It is really easy=
 to become unemployed when you are on the loosing side and the winning side=
 is not interested in recruiting your unit. Also, Musashi was a bit of jerk=
. One of Hideyoshi=E2=80=99s problems in 1590 was that he had more follower=
s than he had turf available to reward them with. This is very likely a maj=
or reason for the Korean campaigns. 

As for the Akita, technically they we=
re not a clan.

27803064ygrp-text">
      
      
      <p>Musashi sided with the Toyotomi=
=E2=80=99s and the army of the West.. They lost. Musashi was among other th=
ings at both battles of Osaka castle.. It is really easy to become unemploy=
ed when you are on the loosing side and the winning side is not interested =
in recruiting your unit. Also, Musashi was a bit of jerk. One of Hideyoshi=
=E2=80=99s problems in 1590 was that he had more followers than he had turf=
 available to reward them with. This is very likely a major reason for the =
Korean campaigns. <br clear=3D"none">
<br clear=3D"none">
As for the Akita,=
 technically they were not a clan.<br clear=3D"none">
<br clear=3D"none">
<=
/p>
